description: Borrowed from Latin captīvō; synchronically analyzable as captive +‎ -ate.

verbs.description: captivate (third-person singular simple present captivates, present participle captivating, simple past and past participle captivated)

entries.meaning: To attract and hold (someone's) interest and attention; to charm.
(obsolete) To take prisoner; to capture; to subdue.
